comment.text: This has been in testing for 214 days. Is the maintainer still active? It seems to me that this should either be pushed to stable or canceled.

bugs.title: vtun: high CPU usage after SIGHUP

bugzilla.short_desc: vtun: high CPU usage after SIGHUP

long_desc.thetext:
A vulnerability was found in the vtun package. When you send a SIGHUP to a vtun client process and it cannot connect to the remote server, vtun tries to reconnect without sleep between each attempt.
In result, the vtun process uses a lot of CPU, and writes to syslog without limit.

References (with proposed patch):

https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=818489

Created vtun tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1319859]
Affects: epel-5 [bug 1319860]
Affects: epel-6 [bug 1319861]
vtun-3.0.3-15.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
vtun-3.0.3-15.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
vtun-3.0.3-15.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
vtun-3.0.3-15.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
vtun-3.0.1-10.el5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

Closing this as per:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2016/q2/157
http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2016/q2/173
